meanings.definition: A bud or shoot on a plant.
meanings.sent1: The knosps on the rose bush were starting to bloom.
meanings.sent2: I carefully observed the knosps on the tree to see when they would open.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel played hide-and-seek among the knosps on the branches.
meanings.sent4: In the garden, the knosps seemed like tiny promises of future flowers.
meanings.sent5: The knosps swayed gently in the breeze, a sign of life and growth.

meanings.sent1: Each spring, the plants knosps into beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent2: The seeds knosps into vibrant green shoots after the rain.
meanings.sent3: The garden seemed to magically knosps overnight, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Hope knosps in the hearts of those who patiently wait for better days.
meanings.sent5: The barren land knosps with new life as the first signs of growth appear.
